content:
Customizing Messaging Components with sObject Formulas

Use sObject formulas to control the way that your messaging components appear in any non-Text format.

This article applies to: Messaging for In-App, Messaging for Web, enhanced WhatsApp, enhanced Facebook Messenger, and enhanced Apple Messages for Business channels.

sObject formulas customize all other supported formats, such as Buttons, Card Carousel, List Selector, and Quick Replies. They create values that are related to parameters of the RecordId type.

In a question component with dynamic options where each option references a record, use sObject formulas to create the values for the options' titles or images.

sObject formulas in messaging components behave similarly as they do elsewhere in Salesforce, such as with custom formula fields. They can also reference any parameters and constants that have been autogenerated or manually added to the component.

A messaging component can have up to 5 custom parameters. To access more data while respecting this limit, try adding relationships between the MessagingSession object and other objects.

This example formula fetches a custom field value on a custom record that's associated with a case, which in turn is associated with a messaging session: {!$Parameters.MessagingSession.Case.Custom_Record__c.CustomField__c}

EXAMPLE This sObject formula shows the title of a dynamic option for a list of case records. It consists of the case number, a dash, and the case subject: CaseNumber & “ - “ & Subject

See also: Add Dynamic Images to Messaging Components
title: Customizing Messaging Components with sObject Formulas
